title: Ticket #4363: Uninitialized data in write system call
description:
==10237== Syscall param write(buf) points to uninitialised byte(s)
==10237==    at 0x35CE00E6E0: __write_nocancel (in /lib64/libpthread-2.12.so)
==10237==    by 0x42CF92: NamedPipeWriter::write_data(void*, int) (named_pipe_writer.unix.cpp:127)
==10237==    by 0x4284FF: LocalServer::write_data(void*, int) (local_server.UNIX.cpp:237)
==10237==    by 0x42312E: ProcFamilyServer::write_to_client(void*, int) (proc_family_server.cpp:73)
==10237==    by 0x4236C9: ProcFamilyServer::get_usage() (proc_family_server.cpp:254)
==10237==    by 0x423E62: ProcFamilyServer::wait_loop() (proc_family_server.cpp:509)
==10237==    by 0x429CFD: main (procd_main.cpp:540)
==10237==  Address 0x7fefff7b9 is on thread 1's stack
==10237==
remarks:
2014-May-13 17:00:30 by tlmiller:
This appears to be caused by uninitialized padding bytes inserted by the compiler after ==total_proportional_set_size_available==. Making the padding bytes explicit should shut valgrind up. 

diff --git a/src/condor_procd/proc_family_io.h b/src/condor_procd/proc_family_io
index 8092fea..93c9540 100644
--- a/src/condor_procd/proc_family_io.h
+++ b/src/condor_procd/proc_family_io.h
@@ -89,6 +89,10 @@ struct ProcFamilyUsage {
 #if HAVE_PSS
     unsigned long total_proportional_set_size;
     bool total_proportional_set_size_available;
+    // These exist to make valgrind quit whining.
+    bool pad1;
+    bool pad2;
+    bool pad3;
 #endif
        int           num_procs;
        // These are signed so a negative number indicates uninitialized
@@ -107,6 +111,7 @@ struct ProcFamilyUsage {
 #if HAVE_PSS
                total_proportional_set_size(0),
                total_proportional_set_size_available(0),
+               pad1(0), pad2(0), pad3(0),
 #endif
                num_procs(0),
         block_reads(0),

2014-May-14 13:36:25 by tlmiller:
This patch silences valgrind and shouldn't cause alignment/packing issues on any platform (because the bools are now in a group that's a multiple of 4).

2014-May-14 13:39:50 by gthain:
CODE REVIEW Looks good
